website_summaries.verdict: If you need a sharp leather punch that can punch holes in other materials too, the ProMaster is a reliable choice.
pros: Good construction on this well made tool
Works on leather and many other thick fabrics and materials, like cardboard or canvas
cons: Turning the wheel to change hole sizes can be a little difficult

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this hole puncher. Update: I've been using this hole punch for a while now and felt I needed to add an update. I couldn't be happier with it! Its been great for heavy leather, vinyl and the many layers of fabrics I use for making tote bags. When I hear a satisfying "click" as I'm punching a hole I know it's going to be perfect. I mostly use it for rivets, rivet snaps and magnetic snaps. I take my tools seriously and this is a wonderful tool, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: C Halver

customer_reviews.title: Best leather hole punch ever!
customer_reviews.text: Buying the right belt is a challenge and then you get it home and find out the holes that are there, do not provide the right level of fit. One of the holes is too tight and the next one is too loose. I would use my drill to make a new hole, it would do the job, but sometimes it would scratch the belt or the hole would be too small/too big. Also, my wife has purses where she'd like the strap adjusted. This device works so well and I can't believe it's taken me this long to purchase one. Do not hesitate to buy this - high quality craftsmanship and it works just great!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Thornton

customer_reviews.title: Works great on fabric!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something to make installing eyelets in a corset style wedding dress I am making for my daughter easier. Boring a hole with an awl was tedious and hard on my hands. I wasn't sure if this would work on fabric but it was amazing!! I had 2 layers of satin and 2 layers of interfacing. I added an extra layer of interfacing on the outside just to punch through. It worked perfectly. It isn't a sewing tool I will need often, but when I do, I am sure glad I have this. The punch is very sharp and did not fray the fabric at all. Highly recommended to have in your sewing arsenal.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and makes clean holes; great deal
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool. It is easy to use [just (1) rotate the punch head dial to select the size of hole you want to punch (it clicks securely into place for each different size) (2) position the punch where you want to make the hole (3) pull the handles together until you feel it punch through the leather]. It is super simple and makes holes that are just as clean as the ones from the factory. So it is an excellent tool, that works great and was a great deal for the money; I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: FOR THE LOVE OF GOD DON’T BUY THIS TOOL
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the worst tool I’ve ever bought in my life! And I shop at harbor freight on a regular basis! This tool broke after ~20 uses on leather that was less than 2mm thick. The rotating punch doesn't make complete contact with the brass pad and punches that I haven’t even used are dented! This is literally (in the truest sense of the word) a complete piece of garbage. Don't make the same mistake I did and get fooled by the five star reviews, if you buy this tool it will end up in your trashcan in no time.
customer_reviews.author: yes

customer_reviews.title: Stellar Product and Service
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent leather hole punch, and I received it practically the next day after ordering! I have problems with carpal tunnel, but it is super easy to use with comfortable padded handles. It punches holes with no issues whatsoever, effortlessly leaving a nice, clean hole. I initially made the hole too small, but was able to very easily correct the snafu! The only problem had nothing to with the product itself . . . unfortunately, it arrived with the packaging ripped open - it simply needed to be packed more securely.
customer_reviews.author: Seeker

customer_reviews.title: Good, but...
customer_reviews.text: Worked great, good quality, but broke down fairly quickly. I had roughly a 1000+ holes to punch on a costume (9oz and 5oz leather) Worked great for a while, but started clogging after a while. coating the bore with bees wax seemed to help this for a while. One of the punches fell out (not one I was using) but they can be removed/replaced/reinstalled. Stopped completely punching, but a quick twist at the bottom of the punching helped this. Frame bent a bit, but thats probably my gorilla grip. Overall, not bad, worked well for what I needed, but fought me along the way.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Boyd

customer_reviews.title: and i'm very pleased. it fits nicely in your hand
customer_reviews.text: my last leather punch was over 100 years old... consequently, trying to match it was impossible... i chose to replace it with this one, and i'm very pleased. it fits nicely in your hand, is easier to use than most, and appears very sturdy. of course, nothing replaces practice with any tool, so i always keep a bit of leather or any other material that i might need to punch (especially for grommets), and practice a bit before using the tool on the main event! so far so good. i'll check back in another 100 years...
customer_reviews.author: catcrazy

customer_reviews.title: POS!!!  People with small hands need not apply!!
customer_reviews.text: First, if you have hands on the smaller side, pass this one by! I wear size XL gloves, and can barely work this device because of the handle spread being so large. The hole punches/cutters themselves are a very weak point. THEY ARE BLUNT/DEAD DULL OUT OF THE BOX! When trying it out, with the larges hole punch, on 8oz leather, the edge of the punch/cutter rolled inward...... now it's useless. And as far as I can tell, the cutters are NOT replaceable. Next, the pivot on the handle side is loose, flexes, and binds when trying to use the device. Overall, this is just junk! This one is going into the trash!!
customer_reviews.author: EdCaffreyMS

customer_reviews.title: An excellent replacement.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased your rotary hole punch to replace the old, dull one I have. I was in pressed with it on the first hole I punched. I am very happy with my purchased. I looked at several different punches that were offered at Amazon. I read the reviews and felt yours meet my needs. The price was a little higher than some of the others, but with the leverage mechanism it makes using it very easy and worth the "little" higher price. The Pro-master jaws allows 1/4" leather to be punched very easy. My old punch would open to 3/4" (I never punched anything that thick). I wish I had this punch before I started my latest projects.
customer_reviews.author: Dabldoo

customer_reviews.title: good with two issues
customer_reviews.text: Works well and is solidly built. There are a couple of things to note. First, turning the wheel is very hard so people with hand weakness or arthritis might have difficulty. Second, for some reason, the hole sizes are not labeled, and there is no paperwork to indicate what the sizes are, or at least I didn't see any. That said, it is a sturdy and overbuilt hole punch. I've used it for thick leather. I tested it on a magazine and it easily punched a hole through and through.
customer_reviews.author: Nadim Kanafani

customer_reviews.title: Clean holes every time!
customer_reviews.text: I use this to create holes for rivets in fabric purse handles. I used to use an awl or other device to creat a hole. The holes were inadequate and rivets would sometimes bend during setting because the hole was not big enough and the excess fabric got in the way. This tool solved the problem. It cuts a nice clean hole through multiple layers of fabric. It’s heavy duty so sometimes I need to use two hands to squeeze it, but that aspect is what makes it work so well. This is a great hole punch.
customer_reviews.author: LadyO

customer_reviews.title: sturdy metal with comfortable rubber grips
customer_reviews.text: The quality and workmanship of the Pro-Master Belt Hole Punch goes way beyond my expectations. They are heavy, sturdy metal with comfortable rubber grips. I had tried the day before I ordered them (for over an hour ) to punch holes in two strips of leather to make handles for a basket I had made. These pliars did the job through two layers of leather in one snip! They are the best I have ever seen. Thanks for the surprise gift of eyelet pliars and gold eyelets. They are great quality also. I highly recommend your products.
customer_reviews.author: M.A.E.

customer_reviews.title: Effective and pretty easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This worked pretty well in adding additional holes to the straps on my Birks. I didn’t give it 5 stars for two reasons. The hole that I was punching came slightly dented, so I had to do extra punching to ensure good holes. Secondly, the coupon provided for the leather scissors was already expired, so I wasn’t able to take advantage of that. At the end of the day, it saved me $ by being able to do this myself.
customer_reviews.author: B. Peden

customer_reviews.title: Really easy to use
customer_reviews.text: It really is "Easy to use". I am a woman who do not know the names of most tools, much less using them. However, this hold puncher is really as easy as 1 2 3. Clean punch every time, love it.
customer_reviews.author: EH

customer_reviews.title: High quality punch, works great for leather belts
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! This tool is very easy to use and works very effectively for punching holes in belts. I haven’t tried any other materials, but I’m confident this tool would handle it flawlessly. It feels very high quality. The extra punching plates were definitely a nice bonus. One thing, make sure to clean out the punched material from inside the metal punch part, or you will have trouble cutting future things. Overall a fantastic quality product that works well at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: TechFox

customer_reviews.title: Punchy in a Good Way
customer_reviews.text: Well made tool that punches holes through thick leather belts like a hot knife through butter - or at least a cold knife. I've only used it on a couple of Carhartt belts, which had grown too large for me but were like new, and it punched holes through the relatively thick leather with ease. I suppose the task would depend heavily on one's hand strength, but I don't see how it could get much easier. The construction on the tool seems to be of good quality and I suspect I'll not need another in my lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: S. Gargus

customer_reviews.title: ProMaster Belt Hole Punch
customer_reviews.text: The ProMaster Belt Hole Punch punches holes just fine however, it has what I consider two major design flaws...In order to close the tool and use the clasp, the wheel must be rotated so that the punch tubes are AWAY from the punch plate, this is very annoying...Secondly, the handles when fully open are 4 INCHES WIDE at their narrowest point and 6 INCHES at the widest...If you have smaller hands you will NOT like this tool...Unless you don't mind using the tool with both hands like a hedge trimmer....The ads should explain all this.............
customer_reviews.author: G_man

customer_reviews.title: What to Know
customer_reviews.text: This product may have been bit better than similar products in this setting and quality, yet the punches were dull and not well aligned with the punch pad on clicking in rotation. I found the product acceptable but lacking the finer points needed for anything but a starter level craftsman. This means it is better than its competition but you will get only what you almost paid for so, expectations should not be too high for higher trade level leather workers.
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: Great hole punch!
customer_reviews.text: I used this to punch holes in my leather belt I am making for me, a dog collar for my pup, useful for making extra holes in wristbands for extra style. No problems with it! The eyelet tool is great too! Used that for wristband decorations. UPDATE (January 13, 2017): I still like this hole puncher & the eyelet tool. Still recommend them highly. I docked one star because the seller has contacted me three times to write this review after my original review was written on December 31, 2016. Twice on January 1, 2017. Third time was this morning (Jamuary 13, 2017).
customer_reviews.author: Brendie H.

customer_reviews.title: highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with this. Compound lever makes strong grip. the punch ends were all sharp upon arrival. no problem with cutting thick vegetable tanned tooling leather or thin suede leather - though as they recommend, use a piece of cardboard underlayer for thin material. the extra punch plates seem handy, although I never wore out the one on my previous revolving punch. the black coating to prevent rust is nice - my previous Tandy punch tool rusted - and generally was inferior to this one. a pleasant surprise to get a small supply of eyelets and tool as an extra. the sellers seem to care about customer satisfaction.
customer_reviews.author: James C Rosen

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, well made, easy on the hands
customer_reviews.text: This was perfect. I wanted to cut through some vegan leather, and this was easy to use (even with my tendonitis) and cut perfect holes through multiple layers of vegan leather.. The tool is sturdy and feels very well made. It was exactly what I wanted. The handles were comfortable and the extra leverage it gives with punching through makes it much easier than standard pliers. I was able to make holes wherever I wanted, exactly where I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Foo Fish

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Bigger than I expected, but with the cushioned handles, even my small hands have no difficulty using this punch. I actually bought it for fabric, so I was concerned how well it would work, as it was intended for leather. By simply placing cardboard beneath the fabric, the punch worked perfectly, even on such a thin material. Very happy with my purchase and haven't even begun to explore what else I may end up using this for, in addition to the bonus tools that came with it.
customer_reviews.author: K. J. Waters

customer_reviews.title: A must have
customer_reviews.text: I could not wait to give a review of this little machine because it is absolutely necessary for a girls closet. I am so happy, I already fixed many belts. Most belts come in medium size and are too big. The machine makes perfect holes. With no effort, I was able to punch the holes and they are perfect in the front and in the back of the belt. The orange belt in the picture is the front and the gold side is the back. I only made one hole to match the original.
customer_reviews.author: teeinep

customer_reviews.title: makes life much easier for at home alterations
customer_reviews.text: it’s a little hard changing the settings by turning the wheel, but i’m also sort of a weak baby. i’m very short and small waisted, so i always have awkward belts and leather bags that are waaaaaay too long on me lol. this hole puncher has been a super tidy solution to that... i used to just sigh and roll my eyes as i listened to podcasts and patiently but witheringly drilled holes into my leathers and pleathers by twisting a skinny steak knife forever on both sides of the new hole haha. gone are those days, blessedly...
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t make clean and complete cuts
customer_reviews.text: Received this punch and was super excited to use it. Tried out a couple of test holes and was dismayed to see that it didn’t cut all the way through. Tried all the sizes and same thing. Looked at the alignment and noticed that the punch was slightly cockeyed to the plate. The seller was great and sent me a replacement very quickly, but alas same issue. Sadly, I ended up going with another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Henry

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: The reason I purchased this product was, if it worked as advertised it would be a great deal cheaper than buying new belts. After using it on one belt it has now paid for itself. The rest is gravy. Upon inspection I find this to be a solid and well made product. It works just as well as it was advertised. I have problems with my hands and had high hopes for the product. I have not been disappointed. I believe it to be well worth the price and would recommend it to those who are considering purchasing it.
customer_reviews.author: wb

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: I have 6 belts. I'm in the middle of an extremely strict diet and I have lost 65 lbs. in 13 weeks. In that time I went from size 50 pants to size 44. Instead of replacing my belts over and over I was able to trim the length and make exactly the right sized and spaced belt holes to match my shrinking girth. Really easy to use and it makes amazingly clean perfect holes. This would be great for a belt-maker, crafts person or leather worker. Edited to add 85 lbs. down and about 10 inches off each of the 6 belts and countless holes punched. The Leather Hole Punch Tool is still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be well built, easy to use and even has spare parts for the cutting foot pad. Have only used it once and must say it is quite effortless to use compared to others I have owned. Now we'll see how it holds up - but as I said, it looks and feels well built and durable. I would recommend this tool.
customer_reviews.author: paul j silvernail sr

customer_reviews.title: JUNK - PURE JUNK
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get this. It is JUNK. I tried to use it to punch holes in canvas dog collar and after struggling through the first punch, it wasn’t sharp enough to do any more. I kept trying and it only chewed its way through causing massive fraying. This is worthless and, by the way, an insult to women with smaller hands. I would gladly pay three times the cost for a tool that actually works. Made in China CRAP.
customer_reviews.author: Britney

customer_reviews.title: would be more comfortable to use
customer_reviews.text: There are a lot of REALLY cheap hole punchers on the market, And some of them aren't inexpensive. I was looking for something that had some quality to it, would be more comfortable to use, fit my large hands, and match up to a price point that made sense. The Pro-Master seems to fit the bill. I have used it a couple times now and it works just like you would expect-easily and punches clean holes. I think you'll be happy. Packaging is good also.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Competency of product to deliver
customer_reviews.text: The product exceeded my expectations. It is made with a high degree of quality steel. It is nicely packaged. It comes with three extra metal circles to absorb the friction of the punch without dulling it. The wheel that has various hole sizes is a bit difficult to turn, but perhaps with use it will be able to be moved with ease. Lubrication might also assist, but really not needed. A surprise: included was a ruler- measuring spacing of holes and awl to mark the leather.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use and makes great holes!
customer_reviews.text: Measured the distance between the existing holes and used the sharp straight tool to make marks on the leather for the new holes. Easy to squeeze and punch the new holes (I even have a hurt thumb right now and it was able to easily squeeze the tool). Once I squeezed, I held the punch in place and turned the strap side to side to make the hole. I think the three holes I punched look better than some of the ones that the manufacturer made. Highly recommend this tool. This is a breast plate for my daughter’s horse. I made the bottom three holes in the picture.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy L Moyer

customer_reviews.title: Very well made and does a great job
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hole punch because the other 2 leather punches I had just ended up falling apart. This one feels much more well made. It punches holes beautifully and is easy to use. The punch also is very portable and I close it's handle and clip it shut ( make sure you turn punch so it is in between punches... the it can use the clip and stay shut) I am not getting paid or anything for my review, it is my personal observation. This is a good leather punch and I would recommend it !
customer_reviews.author: fiannafahl

customer_reviews.title: Neat
customer_reviews.text: It worked out fairly well for me. I purchased this to pop a few more holes in my belts since I have lost weight. Probably will be using it for other custom leather work as well. Pretty neat and easy to use tool. Dislikes as of right now are the stubby Phillip's head screw driver that only fits in tiny hands. No biggie seeing that I have thousands vested in tools anyhow. Also the rotary head/ locking clip are super stiff. Most likely from being new still. May loosen up the more i use them. Overall i would purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: Parker hayden thompson

customer_reviews.title: Cuts are clean sharp hole
customer_reviews.text: An excellent product, I think; however, I found it very difficult to turn the wheel to select the proper sized hole needed. I looked in vain for an attached lever or something to release the wheel. Ultimately I had to cushion the wheel with a potholder to protect my fingers in order to manage the adjustment. Once in position, I can see that the wheel's tightness allows it to cut holes cleanly even through dense material.
customer_reviews.author: Ella

customer_reviews.title: Suggestions
customer_reviews.text: I used it for punching extra holes in my leather belts. It is a thoughtful tool that comes with a measuring scale, an awl to mark a location and remove chads and extra cutting "pads". It works and can produce, with care, clear holes. But some simple improvements are needed: 1) a black cutting tube, against a black belt makes centering the cutter harder than necessary. The awl needs a larger handle; the current handle is so thin (small diameter) it can slip, dangerously. The measuring scale is clear plastic: it is hard to see the scale's black markings, against a black belt. This review is mostly a safety warning and in the hope the manufacturer address these issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Used this to add a hole to a nice belt
customer_reviews.text: I got this product since I needed to punch a hole in a nice leather belt that I had and wanted to do it a little more cleanly than I felt like I could achieve with a hammer and nail or some other improvised solution. That said this product does take up some space, and I'm not totally sure when I'll use it again. So I'd say that if you have a nice belt you don't want to risk messing up it is probably worth, or of course if you plan to be punching lots of holes. The product was easy to operate, and made a clean hole in my belt with little trouble.
customer_reviews.author: JCS

customer_reviews.title: The hole puncher does it's job.
customer_reviews.text: I have never had to use a hole puncher before. I am a small person and my hands are not very strong. I had to have my grown son do the belts. I bought shoes that have a strap and a buckle. The strap is very narrow and the hole went through the end of the leather. The puncher is very good. You just need a stronger person to get the holes in the right place and all the through. It is a great buy for the money. I just need more muscle.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbie

customer_reviews.title: DARN GOOD VALUE!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned one hole-punch in my life. It was cheap, but at the tine I purchased it, it seemed ample enough. Fast forward to last Saturday when I received my new Pro Master punch. WHAT A DIFFERENCE! The thing is solid, has amazing rubberized grips, a barrel stop that is rock solid and accurate, punch cylinders that are made for abuse and a little kit to keep the thing going for years! I could not be happier. I think you could pay a lot more money— but what a value at the price!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Scadden

customer_reviews.title: So easy to grip
customer_reviews.text: Previously I had one of the standard, silver punches you see floating around. This one takes less than half the effort to punch through even thick, tough leather. Punching Two sheets of 2.5mm leather at once barely requires any grip strength. The only drawback is that it doesn't open very wide, so you can't punch 3 sheets at once. It's holding up about as well as can be expected. Definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: trail.biker

customer_reviews.title: Money saver
customer_reviews.text: Fortunately I have lost some weight recently, and none of my belts fit me. Instead of purchasing all new belts I bought this and added one or two new holes so they now fit. It was very simple, and the product works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: I needed to punch holes in the straps of a leather attache a friend had made for me. I figured to give this leather punch a try as it would probably cost me more to have it done than to purchase the tool. It took me about 5 minutes to figure out how to use the punch (thanks to clear instructions emailed earlier to me) and to punch the holes I needed. The punch is well made and I suspect will last me for a very long time. Definitely a good purchase on my part.
customer_reviews.author: Duane W. Pegg

customer_reviews.title: Out of alignment be careful when rotating its sharp!
customer_reviews.text: The punch is good but is a little bit out of alignment i wish the base pad of the punch was mede out of a better material brass, bronze or copper this way it will make it 100% sturdy, but is good that they send you a cuple of replacements. I used to punch a leather belt and a watch belt worked great!
customer_reviews.author: Night Fury

customer_reviews.title: GREAT DEAL!
customer_reviews.text: This was a great value and the shipping time was fantastic. There is nothing more rewarding than being able to order a tool you need ASAP and it arrives in only two days. Not only was it delivered fast but it was a good value as it came with a ruler, small screw driver, an awl, and three 50% off coupons for other tools I could use off their website. Good sturdy tool and an excellent value!
customer_reviews.author: NtotheS

customer_reviews.title: Leather Hole Punch Set
customer_reviews.text: Leather Hole Punch Set was exactly what I wanted. Trying to punch hole thru leather wallets with fabric interior and card slots was very easy to use & punched the hole right thru with no resistance. Only reason I gave it a 4 for easy to hold is because I have a very small hand & have to stretch hand to hold punch, but for the limited time I use it for just one wallet at a time no problem
customer_reviews.author: C. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product for many reasons.
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying I've never used anything like this before and I was very pleased with this hole punch. It is very easy to use, including being easy on my arthritic hands. That's invaluable to me. The solid, sound construction lets me know that they'll work beautifully for years to come. I'll be using them mostly for book binding and thick paper crafts so they are very versatile despite being designed for leather. I love them!
customer_reviews.author: Patty Leibnitz

customer_reviews.title: I'm very glad I did
customer_reviews.text: The item arrived on time and works fantastically. I have a wholesale membership with a leather supply company but didn't hesitate to purchase this handy dandy tool. I'm very glad I did. I'm a petite girl with small hands. The special handle definitely does make it easier to punch holes in the leather.
customer_reviews.author: DPlacer

customer_reviews.title: So Much Smarter Than Buying New Belts
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been losing weight for the last 18 months which requires new, smaller clothes. Unfortunately pants are not as easy to adjust as my belts are with is tool. This is a complete kit - ruler to measure the distance between existing holes; a sharp awl to mark the new hole locations & the punch itself. The punch does not require too much hand strength for a clean & complete hole.
customer_reviews.author: Nikon 1

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: This tool makes crisp, sharp holes in leather. I have used it to make several size holes. It is a little hard to rotate into different hole size positions, but I found that using a small screwdriver to release the catch is easy to do and makes the movement easy. I have punched through 2 layers of the leather I'm using (total thickness of almost 1/4 inch) without any difficulty.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer lee

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t do what it says.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this. I was really looking forward to this tool. The smallest hole punch doesn’t work. I can’t get a clean cut. Save your money and buy a cropidile it doesn’t have as many settings but will punch through leather way better than this.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew M. Bunker

customer_reviews.title: Easy and just works
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to punch a small hole in a watch band that fit too loosely, once I knew the size of the hole needed it took about 10 seconds to set up and get a perfect hole. The only area for improvement would be to label the size of the punches or if I missed where they are labeled make it easier to read because I looked and did not see a label (luckily I knew my hole was going to be the smallest size punch so was easy).
customer_reviews.author: oncoendo

customer_reviews.title: Great Hole Maker
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this item to add a few holes to a couple of my belts that were getting too big. My item arrived very quickly and I was impressed with the quality of the product. However, I could not get the wheel to move into position to use it as I had planned. I contacted the folks and they sent a replacement that arrived on a Sunday and it works just as I had hoped. Good item with great support.
customer_reviews.author: PatrickDee

customer_reviews.title: A real great tool for work on real leather
customer_reviews.text: I had lost weight and needed to do the "tighten up" on my belt with some new holes. I'd tried something else, even poking holes in one belt. Did not work. Then I found this Leather Hole Punch tool. This tool is so excellent that I didn't even realize I'd completed the process. Perfect hole! An excellent tool at a great price. If you need one, this IS the one to get. Way Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Hank51

customer_reviews.title: This Works
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a lower cost leather hole punch which didn't work on one of my thinner belts. I took a chance on this item and I am glad I did. It is a well made hole punch that I successfully used for one of my expensive belts that is pure cowhide. It was easy to use. Size the hole, use the included ruler and create the hole. It was simple. Thanks for providing the excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: T. Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Leater hole punch
customer_reviews.text: I purchased so I could punch extra holes in my belts. Very pleased, punched a couple of holes in a new leather belt that was a little long and didn't have enough holes, it worked really well. You do need a strong hand grip. I've lost some of my hand strength, so the first hole didn't go through, I got it the second time. On a second hole, I used both hands and got a clean punch.
customer_reviews.author: Gillie Bean

customer_reviews.title: Got punch drunk!
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use that I put holes in things that should not have holes. Actually the tool is very simple to use and has 3 replaceable stop backings to prolong the tool life (made of softer metal so that you do not lose the sharp punch edge). Ergonomic grips and minimal force required to punch the toughest leather/ plastic combinations contribute to a remarkable little tool with high value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Starcutter

customer_reviews.title: I wish it would open its material thickness capacity to 9mm, not just 6.5mm...
customer_reviews.text: I like the short stroke, clean cut. Snappy line-up clicks. Compound leverage. I dislike 6.5mm maximum material thickness capacity. Not enough width capacity to accommodate leather holsters or knife scabbard with triple- or double-thickness, more like 9mm thickness. It should be redesign to accommodate these since the leverage and sharp edges could handle them.
customer_reviews.author: gabriel e.

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable Product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this belt hole puncher because I was tired of paying $10 to my tailor every time I bought a new belt and needed more holes punched in them (I have a small waist). This product is unreal for the cost! It punched holes no problem through some of my VERY thick leather belts without needing much force at all. I should have bought this a long time ago! Incredible value!!!
customer_reviews.author: Heather V

customer_reviews.title: Solid, Satisfying and Super Easy
customer_reviews.text: After six months of work, i managed to get my waist size down to the last hole in my belts. Since I have several belts, i did not want to go out and buy new ones. I received this puncher yesterday, and today i punched my first belt. The device was very easy to use and worked perfectly. In fact, it was so satisfying, i'm actually looking forward to punching holes in my other belts. It has already paid for itself many times over. Also, it was nice to buy a product made in america and made solidly. It is nice to know that some people are still making quality tools here in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: john k. crossman

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Very prompt delivery, quality product, highly recommended. I purchased an ornamental rivet kit that came with a so called leather punch. It wouldn’t come close to punching a hole in leather or nylon. It did however do a great job on a single sheet of paper. I ordered the Pro Master and soon received a proper punch for the application. Works great, you won’t be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Lindquist

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: Product showed up missing some parts and showing some signs of wear. Brown box and envelope looked good. See pics for recieved and missing items.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: I hesitated to purchase this tool afraid I would be unable to squeeze the pliers hard enough to punch. It is very easy to punch. I have used it on a variety of materials, cork, faux leather, fabric with interfacing and all were easily punched through. Perfect for my sewing room.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hole punch to make my life easier, because my Goldstar Press would not work to make holes in the cotton webbing I use for my purses! Well, it works great! I am very pleased and recommend it to anyone that needs a hole press. It is very substantial and you feel like you have a great tool for your money! Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Scarletrider

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: was nice to have a tool that works like it was made to last ,works better than good ,in fact making a order for more for some friends on a ranch ,,,want mine back ,they keep borrowing haha very happy..THANKS
customer_reviews.author: Johnnie Hodgson

customer_reviews.title: Worth the slightly added price...
customer_reviews.text: It is absolutely true....”You get what you pay for”. After disappointing experiences with cheaper brands, enough was enough. This punch is extremely well built and sturdy and was easy to grip and use. Had no problems adding additional holes to my belt. I am sure I will be using this item for many years to come. Not really had a need for the other items in the set, but who knows...maybe in the future they will come in handy.
customer_reviews.author: Michael from Queens, NY

customer_reviews.title: Great leather hole puncher
customer_reviews.text: I am glad I made this purchase. I bought this product because some of the shoulder strap on my pocketbooks are too long and because some of my son's leather belts are too large. I was able to resolve the matter without having to take these items to a shoemaker. The only minor negative is that turning the wheel to select the punch for the correct hole size may not be an easy feat for some people who do not have sufficient strength in their fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Miri Riva

customer_reviews.title: Clean, consistent punches from this leather hole puncher
customer_reviews.text: Excellent leather hole puncher! I bought this because I needed a tool to add some extra holes to a leather purse strap. It was extremely easy to use and looks like it would hold up over time. I’m already brainstorming other items I need to use this on. I can’t attest to a variety of materials as I only used this on leather so far.
customer_reviews.author: Devon

customer_reviews.title: Buy this for the hole punch, NOT the grommet setter
customer_reviews.text: Hole punch is beefy. The grommet pliers are garbage. The metal folded the second time I tried to squeeze a grommet down. Had to hammer it back into place. Now I only use the grommet pliers at the start (to flare out the metal) and then finish it off with a hammer. The pressure that it takes to get a snug, flush fit of the grommet, collapses the grip of the pliers. I guess you can't have your cake and eat it too with this one...
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Barnett

customer_reviews.title: Punches through very thick belt leather with ease.
customer_reviews.text: This tool is STURDY and the punch you select snaps in place as you rotate the wheel to the desired size hole. I have some belts that are just shy of a 1/4'' and this punch went right through leaving a clean hole. I had purchased a lesser punch and the punch wheel slipped and made a mess of the hole. This punch is a great product, you will not be disappointed with your purchase.
customer_reviews.author: To the Right of Attila  the Hun

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The leather hole punch is very easy to use and is a solid tool. I expected to have to push hard to get the hole punched through the thick leather but not the case. It took very little effort to use. I ordered because we had a very old leather punch that I could not squeeze hard enough to punch through anything.
customer_reviews.author: Sue M

customer_reviews.title: Holy Holer!
customer_reviews.text: SO much sharper and easier to use than my old leather punch! Very clean holes. Very easy to punch through tough leather, as the compound action lessens the force necessary. The extras (ruler, probe, extra brass pads, screwdriver) they include with this punch may never be necessary, but add security to the package deal. I'm so glad I decided to buy this one and give away my old one.
customer_reviews.author: California Doug

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This was fantastically easy to use, and the result was amazing. I bought two new belts online but when they arrived, they were a bit too long. With this punch, I was able to make holes with clean edges in just the right size. And I did it in almost no time! Presto change-o, my belts now fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: AWilliams

customer_reviews.title: A Good Leather Punch !!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this hole punch. I don’t only use it for putting holes in leather belts, but also dog collars, purses, jewelry, and harness leather. The punches click into place solidly, the handles are comfortable even for my arthritic hands, and the holes punch clean. The spare anvils are an extra plus.
customer_reviews.author: MimiTop Contributor: Jewelry Making

customer_reviews.title: Does the job - some minor observations
customer_reviews.text: Good product, does the job, very easy to use. The pressing plates are plastic with a little circular metal insert. I think they should have made the whole plate metal; but they do give you extras so that’s good. When punching through some fabrics I find it helps to rotate the tool once completely compressed in fabric. This makes the cut clean and complete. Other than that this tool works well.
customer_reviews.author: AnMeli

customer_reviews.title: It is easy to use and it works. The hole is too big for the watch strap
customer_reviews.text: I use to punch a hole for the "Camille Fournet" Leather Strap I bought for the JLC watch. Even the smallest hole is still too big! It still works but I have "OCD", it is OK but not "perfect". I don't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Book Addict1

customer_reviews.title: works ,but I thing I should get an exchange
customer_reviews.text: so works great, but was punching holes and it became disengaged from the post stand, so i just put it back in , works fine but when im not using that hole I keep that diameter that broke off in a drawer . would gladly like an exchange but for now , it works as intended but watch how many holes you plug with it .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: considered #1 Best Seller well it is fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I had bought a belt (Leather) that was too long, and the holes just ran out, sooo I checked on Amazon and bought this punch hole maker, considered #1 Best Seller well it is fantastic, I put the belt on, and just eyeballed where the (additional) holes should be, that worked perfectly ... It took less than 5 minutes to punch (2) two extra holes, and was finally able to wear the belt immediately. I'm very glad to have bought "Pro-Masters" punch set.
customer_reviews.author: Graham P Fielding

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool & Pricw
customer_reviews.text: I like the who;e design. The double hinge males punching hole very easy. The extra pressure plates are a good extra. A future consideration might be to have replaceable tips. It would make the price higher, but save replacing the whole tool when the tips get dull or damaged. Overall I like how it handles the job. Well done.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool, Great Shipping, Great Seller.
customer_reviews.text: Great for what I need. Ordered this to put eyelets in outdoor curtains to connect them together. Kit came super fast, included a lot of eyelets and an eyelet tool, screwdriver and replacement plates for the punch. Strong tool with comfortable grips. Holes punched are super clean and perfect. I highly recommend this product. The sellers are also very friendly and want to make sure you're happy.
customer_reviews.author: David Hagan

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. It doesn't require as much strength as I expected. I have used it to add holes to a leather purse strap. The holes came out very neat and professional looking. This will save me a lot of money and inconvenience by not having to go to a shoe repair for this service. In addition it came with grommets and the tool to put them in. Definitely a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: HJoseph

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly and could not be happier
customer_reviews.text: This tool is terrific for getting your belts dialed into the right size. I have used it on at least a half dozen of various thicknesses and it gets the job done with minimal effort. I have saved money and time by not having to go to the shop repair guy to get my belts adjusted.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Not ideal for watch bands
customer_reviews.text: Speaking only about women’s watch bands, the smallest hole size (2mm) is much larger than the original holes. I’m guessing about 1.25mm would be about right. Seems like a good tool for belts and such but two big for small holes. My wife’s watch band now has the new hole between two others that she needs, but not very elegant. Luckily the hole is mostly hidden once the watch is on her wrist.
customer_reviews.author: David 01760

customer_reviews.title: What a great tool, and since I'm over 75
customer_reviews.text: I had a very old punch from my father-in-law that might be 100 years old, this Pro-Master punch makes it look and act as if it is 100 years old, indeed. What a great tool, and since I'm over 75, my hand strength is not what It used to be so I appreciate the ease of use and don't need the hand strength of 20 year old cow milker. This tool is wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Rex E. Stucker

customer_reviews.title: Decent punch
customer_reviews.text: Nice punch. As a craftswoman I use one daily. This was a purchase to replace my trusty one of another brand I'd had for three years. It cuts great! Disadvantages are the opening, which is quite small. And the hand grip is a quite a bit uncomfortable for my small hands. I do appreciate the extra plates!
customer_reviews.author: Lucy in N.C.

customer_reviews.title: Well made tool largest hole size could be a little bigger.
customer_reviews.text: This leather punch is solidly made and punches cleanly through 10-11 oz tooling leather. I wish it punched slightly bigger holes though. You have to stretch the holes a bit in order to fit eyelets for laces. Maybe it's better to have the holes a bit tight I'm not sure. Anyway great tool.
customer_reviews.author: Robd

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I used the hole punch today for the first time. It was very user friendly. That is important as I am not very strong and wasn't sure I could squeeze it hard enough. I haven't used the grommet tool yet but appreciate the additional small items.
customer_reviews.author: DAR

customer_reviews.title: Excellent punch; outstanding company!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a sewist specializing in small bags, pouches, purses, and handbags made of layered fabrics, vinyl, and leather. I need a strong, easy to handle, durable hole punch to make holes for rivets in my products. This hole punch works great for me, and the company took the time to send complete instructions for applications, care, and use in an email - before my order arrived. That was a nice touch; I had the chance to learn about the product ahead of time, so I could use it immediately without taking time to learn about it, once it came in! I highly recommend this product AND the company!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, sturdy and reliable.
customer_reviews.text: First time using a hole punch tool and it includes some very handy extras as well! Pretty sturdy all around and has proven itself worthy after an extensive wholepunching craft project I did. The holes punch effortlessly almost, yet you may have to twist it back and forth a little for some bigger holes, but that's to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: Braedon A. Lackovic

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding!
customer_reviews.text: I've been trying to buy a hole punch for a long time, when I saw the Pro-Master I wanted to give it a try and I was pleasantly surprised. The hole punch is easy to use, comes with everything you even didn't think you needed. Outstanding. It exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty for real leather punch-
customer_reviews.text: I am totally thrilled with this purchase! Lost some weight and needed to punch new holes in several belts so I ordered the Pro Master. As soon as I took it out of the box I knew this was a REAL TOOL. No trouble at all punching through heavy leather belts. The click stops are solid, the punches are sharp, the handles are sturdy and have great rubber grips. Not cheap craft store junk!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: A good quality, adjustable leather hole puncher
customer_reviews.text: A good quality, adjustable leather hole puncher, and free rivet/grommet pliers as well! I have used other adjustable hole punches, and they are built in a flimsy way that prevents proper hole making - this punch does not suffer that problem. The 'cutting edge' of the punch matches up with the base perfectly, allowing clean cuts every time, and the adjustable 'wheel' locks into place without any play - ensuring accurate and clean holes.
customer_reviews.author: Abe Zettek

customer_reviews.title: this hole punch is so easy to use it is well thought out
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several different hole punches and this one "TOPS THEM ALL"!!! this hole punch is so easy to use it is well thought out, I punch several hundred holes a week and this tool makes it easy compared to any of the other hand tools that I have used to punch holes in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond T. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Great tool at good price
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice tool to have and exactly what I needed - well designed, well made, sturdy, and easy to use. I did not test it on leather yet but I tested it on carton box and it punched a perfect hole effortlessly. It also came as described with all the extras. Overall, I am glad I bought this one and would recommend it. Now I am going to punch holes left and right!
customer_reviews.author: Narciss

customer_reviews.title: Great punch for small jobs.
customer_reviews.text: I have been losing weight and gaining fitness over the past 5 years, and several of my expensive belts were too large. Instead of tossing them, I used the punch to add a couple of 1"-spaced holes to the belts. Now they fit perfectly, and the cost of this punch was much less than one of my belts.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Jack

customer_reviews.title: Well made and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Nice tool and appears to be well made, yes it’s made in China but they did a good job on this tool, not everything made in China is junk. It’s easy to use but that depends on the leather you’re trying to penetrate. Make sure you clear the punch cutter after each punch otherwise it’s difficult to clear the cutter. Make sure you rotate the belt or other material many times while trying to punch.
customer_reviews.author: T. Rainey

customer_reviews.title: ADEQUATE PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: The hole punch performed adequately. It did have several problems. The wheel has very hard to turn. I had to use pliers to turn it. The instructions were non-existent. There has something in the package that I still don't know what it is. The box it came in cannot be reclosed. With some forethought , it could have been a very good product.
customer_reviews.author: SUSAN M. KALGREEN

customer_reviews.title: this product is highly recommended plus the courteous and and tips offered by the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the only product that I am writing my personal assessment because I admire the business philosophy of the seller in putting customer guaranteed satisfaction as their utmost priority. For me, the quality of the product including the extra accessories, exceeds my expectations relative to the price. For the price that is not so expensive, this product is highly recommended plus the courteous and and tips offered by the seller is more than enough to be satisfied. For my small projects including thick fabrics, vinyl, and synthetic leather, that I need to punch and decorate. This product, functions as I wanted to, I am 100% satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: JULIO A.

customer_reviews.title: Inferior product broke on the 12th hole.
customer_reviews.text: I punched exactly 11 holes with this item and when I tried #12, the retaining spring buckled and broke. Cheap design or cheap steel? I don't know but please do NOT waste your money on this item. The little awl that came with this is worth more than this so-called punch.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Fox

customer_reviews.title: Quality hand punch
customer_reviews.text: I recieved this today and delivered on time in a good box. I was pleasantly surprised at the good quality of this punch. Very well constructed of heavy materials. The design is not new, as I have had one similar for over 50 years which I have taken care of. The handles being padded is an excellent feature. I used on 3\16” leather and it punched a very clean hole (s). A very good buy in my opinion ,
customer_reviews.author: AC

product_meta.title: Leather Hole Punch Set for Belts, Watch Bands, Straps, Dog Collars, Saddles, Shoes, Fabric, DIY Home or Craft Projects. Super Heavy Duty Rotary Puncher, Multi Hole Sizes Maker Tool
feature_bullets: 🥇 😃 BRING BACK TO LIFE YOUR FAVORITE BELT: Have fun adjusting your favorite belts to fit you perfectly again. It's super easy and fast to use. Choose the size, rotate the wheel, align your belt and squeeze. You will save time and money not having to buy new belts. It punches sharp, precise round holes of 2mm, 2.5mm, 3mm, 3.5mm, 4mm and 4.5mm.

🌞 LIGHT UP THE WORLD WITH YOUR TALENT AND SKILLS: Multiple uses. 6 hole sizes. Great for crafts, hobbyist, DIY. The extra large punch plate enables better stability and more control when punching through leather, plastic, canvas, cardboard, rubber, polyurethane, fabrics, silk and many other materials.

✅ 👑 GET RIGHT FIT AND COMFORT by adding extra holes to adjust your clothing and other accessories. Perfect for belts, bags, watch bands, saddlery, pet collars, store cards, etc. Ideal for long, repetitive work without causing sore hands or blisters because the handles are cushioned, non-slip and ergonomic.

💪 ⏱ BEING SLOWED DOWN, FRUSTRATED AND STRESSED when needing to add extra holes is a thing of the past. You will spend much less time on making them and much more time enjoying your great results. You don't need much hand strength because its double lever takes the strain away and you're protected from hand or wrist strain. Even if you have arthritis in your hands you'll be able to grip it and squeeze hard enough to punch holes with no problem.

🤝 ✍ 💲 BEST BONUSES: 90 day no questions asked money back guarantee and 3 year product warranty. 100% satisfaction guaranteed. Buy with confidence! Included: 3 extra large punch plates with a screwdriver, an EBOOK with tips and tricks on how to get the best results using your new belt hole punch, ruler and awl tool.
